function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Deleterious health consequences of thermal comfort being artificially maintained in privatised air-conditioned home spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Regulatory failures leading to loss of life, as seen in the grenfell fire incident","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Home as a place where social harms are stored and amplified during lockdowns","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on social inequality, health, and housing.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unexplored concepts such as social murder, ontological security, and home un-making.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of recognition of social harm perspective as a building block for housing studies.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Impact of covid-19 outbreak on indian construction industry","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of systematic approach for value engineering","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adoption of risk assessment in project management","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overprovision of information and functionality leading to increased project cost","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lean construction and value engineering may not address the risk of contagious disease transmission in the built environment.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The research involving data collection may involve direct contact with individuals, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Quality assurance team assessing deliverables can lead to gatherings and meetings, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Industrialist inputs collected through questionnaires may involve physical handling of documents, increasing the risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible spread of contagious diseases due to lack of attention to facility management and disease control measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliability and consistency of data collection and analysis may overlook the impact of contagious diseases and their influence on project management and value engineering","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased demand for space in houses to accommodate work from home could lead to overcrowding and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High dependence on migrant workers in the construction sector","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased labor working hours without addressing labor concerns","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic impact on labor costs, project costs, and recovery of damages","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clarity and proper guidance in the virtual workforce","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of transparency in the construction sector","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disruption in work and movement of labor due to economic recession and covid-19 outbreak","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertainty in estimating the full financial impact of the coronavirus crisis.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited budget and low innovation and technology in facility management services due to the pandemic.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased workload and need for regular maintenance among blue-collar workers in commercial buildings.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Escalation of cement and sand prices by 5% due to supply chain disruption and less availability","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreased space utilization and warehouse efficiency due to supply chain disruption and less availability","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disputes between client and contractor regarding loss-sharing and claims due to covid-19","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased workload on blue-collar workers due to the need for facility management services and creating a safer workplace for workers","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Unforeseen delays, inflation, and weather impacts affecting project scope, scheduling, and costing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low client satisfaction and service quality in the indian construction and real estate sector","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low prevalence of lean construction and skilled contractors/workers","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low implementation of value engineering in construction projects","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited functionality improvement with new technology","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of project overrun and delay","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address sustainable development goals","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disregard for sustainable consumption and production","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Current covid-19 pandemic","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of human health in sustainability goals","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of inclusion of human health in the definition of sustainability","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address physical and mental health as a separate fourth pillar of sustainability","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on mental health due to covid-19, including economic instability, domestic violence, and fear among healthcare workers","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decrease in human activity leading to unattended and endangered species","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Devastating global economic fallout from covid-19","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pressure on corporations to reevaluate globalized supply chain systems","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Economic inequality leading to unequal access to resources such as stable homes, internet, and technology","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased exposure to contagious diseases for individuals in lower income brackets due to employment in service or delivery sectors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inequitable access to online learning resources for lower income individuals, exacerbating educational disparities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to prioritize human health in sustainability goals","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"}]}
